question_stem: Simulation can be used to estimate expected values of the form E[g(X)]=∫−∞∞g(x)f(x)dx E[g(X)] = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} g(x) f(x) dx  The reason we can apply the Central Limit Theorem is that we can always choose ff to be the Normal pdf.

items.solution:
This is not true. f(x) can be any pdf.
The reason we can apply the CLT is because the distribution of the sample mean converges to Normal.
